a long, narrow, magnetic strip inside a rectangular plastic container which records sounds and moving images that can be heard and seen on a television, or a recording of images and sounds: I bought the videotape of "Jurassic Park" for the kids. He watches videotapes of his performances so he can see what needs work. videotape verb [ T ] us

/ˈvɪd·i·oʊˌteɪp/ (short form tape)
Why don’t you videotape the ballgame so you can watch it later?
